resources:
Quizerthon True False Next Correct! Incorrect! Lightning never strikes in the same place twice If you cry in space the tears just stick to your face If you cut an earthworm in half, both halves can regrow their body Humans can distinguish between over a trillion different smells Adults have fewer bones than babies do Napoleon Bonaparte was extremely short Goldfish only have a memory of three seconds There are more cells of bacteria in your body than there are human cells Your fingernails and hair keep growing after you die Birds are dinosaurs It costs the U.S. Mint more to make pennies and nickels than the coins are actually worth Water spirals down the plughole in opposite directions in the northern and southern hemispheres London is the Capital of Britain Buzz Aldrin was the first man to urinate on the moon Twinkies have an infinite shelf life Humans can’t breathe and swallow at the same time The popular image of Santa Claus – chubby, bearded, in red and white clothes – was invented by Coca-Cola for an ad campaign The top of the Eiffel Tower leans away from the sun Drinking alcohol kills brain cells If your large intestine was removed and straightened, it\'d be equal to about twice your height Female kangaroos have three vaginas France was still executing people with a guillotine when the first Stars Wars film came out in 1977 October 10th falls on a Tuesday every year The sun makes up 99.8% of the mass of our solar system Brick buildings can never be more than 10 floors high or they will collapse from the pressure of the bricks on the top layer Oxford University in England predates the Aztec Empire Oreo cookies have existed longer than chocolate chip cookies The smallest bone in the human body is the about the size of a grain of rice Earth is the only planet in our solar system not named after a Greek or Roman god. Earth spins around its axis once a year. A googol is a very large number of a 1 followed by a hundred 0\'s. About half of your body weight is muscle. The prefix \'giga\' means a million Mount Aconcagua is the tallest mountain in the Americas? The country Cameroon borders the Republic of the Congo? The Nintendo 64 game F-Zero-X contains Rainbow Road? The last dynasty in China was the Chou? Independence, Missouri was the start of the Oregon Trail during America\'s westward expansion? Krypton\'s atomic number is 26? Leif Ericson was the first person to cross the Atlantic? FBI means Federal Bureau of Investigation? Al Capone was arrested by the FBI for illegal alcohol sales? There is such a country known as Benin. Czar Nicholas II was executed in 1917? The city Alexandria was named after Alexander the Great? Leningrad (St. Petersburg) suffered a siege of well over two years in WWII. In Mario Kart 64, you flick the control stick twice to make the \'E\'s yellow. Momentum is velocity multiplied by force. A diode is an electrical component. In the "Digimon" TV show, Megaseadramon is beat by MetalGreymon The first set of Crayola crayons had eight colors? Fort Knox is found in Washington D.C. Mitsubishi makes television sets. The only even prime number is 2 Our nose, eyes and ears never stop growing until the day we die The white part of a fingernail is called the \'luna\' You can only see a rainbow with your back to the sun A \'jiffy\' is an actual unit of time. Isaac Newton was an Anglican deacon Mark Twain\'s real name was Samuel Clementine The most common first name in the world is Mohammed (Muhammad) Alexander the Great suffered from symptoms that today would most likely be considered epilepsy The so-called \'perfect age\' is 32, because Jesus Christ died at age 32 The exact translation of the origin of the word \'check-mate\' is \'the king is captured\' The word \'girl\' mostly appears only once in the Bible (any translation) In written English, on average one out of every eight letters is an \'e\' The infinity sign is called a \'lemniscate\' No word in the English language (British) has five consecutive letters that are vowels It takes more than an hour to completely soft-boil an ostrich egg A full-grown grizzly bear can run as fast as a horse Although flightless, Kiwi birds have wings Tigers have striped skin as well as striped fur Other than humans, the only primate that can have blue eyes is the black lemur If a month starts on a Sunday it will contain Friday the 13th There are only 25 countries world-wide in which people drive on the left-hand side of the road There is only one coin denomination in Vietnamese dongs Tuxedo Park, New York is named after the tuxedo dinner jacket Dueling is legal in Paraguay as long as both parties are registered blood donors It was Mark Twain who once said, "Bigamy is having one wife too many. Monogamy is the same." A young hedgehog is called a kitten The Pacific Ocean is larger than the Atlantic Ocean The Suez Canal connects the Red Sea and the Indian Ocean The source of the Nile River is in Egypt The Amazon River is the longest river in the Americas Lake Baikal is the world\'s oldest and deepest freshwater lake The youngest ever Pope was only 11 years old If you multiply 111,111,111 by itself, the answer is 12,345,678,987,654,321 The original colour of Coca-Cola was green D\'Artagnan was one of the original \'Three Musketeers\' Diamond is the hardest naturally-occurring substance on earth Sherlock Holmes actually never said \'Elementary, my dear Watson\'. All Zebras are white with black stripes A man\'s heart beats faster than a woman\'s (on average) Neanderthal\'s brains were bigger than ours (Homo Sapiens) Fingernails grow faster than toenails The first ship to use the \'SOS\' signal was the Titanic The bones of a pigeon are so light that they weigh less than its feathers Natural propane gas has no odor. The phrase \'the blind leading the blind\' comes from the Bible Celine Dion is one of fourteen children.
Settings ResultsActivity” Your Score was: /10 Welcome to Q Try Again Get ready to answer 10 trivia questions! \nClick true or false to answer
